[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Fantasy Football League System (FFLS) defines requirements for authentication, team management, and real-time player statistics.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: FFLS supports user authentication, league operations, player transactions, live stats, and reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: FFLS facilitates player transactions, league management, and live NFL statistics.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: FFLS integrates with authentication, NFL statistics APIs, and databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: FFLS provides a structured web-based UI for team management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: FFLS runs on cloud-hosted web servers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: FFLS uses REST APIs, PostgreSQL for user data, and a secondary database for historical records.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: FFLS ensures secure transactions and real-time updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: FFLS maintains 24/7 availability with scheduled updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: FFLS provides structured navigation and accessibility.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: FFLS links to authentication, reporting, and NFL data providers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 MISSING-TAG2: FFLS optimizes storage for concurrent transactions and rapid retrieval.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: FFLS requires web access and authentication.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: FFLS relies on external APIs, databases, and authentication services.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Team Owner: User managing a fantasy football team.
Commissioner: League administrator with advanced privileges.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 MISSING-TAG1: FFLS is designed for team owners, league commissioners, and administrators.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall authenticate users via username and password.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall retrieve real-time NFL data via external APIs.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall store user transactions and league settings in a primary database.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enable users to add, drop, and trade players with confirmation prompts (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow commissioners to manage league settings with restricted access (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall display real-time NFL player statistics (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall maintain message boards displaying the five most recent messages (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a structured UI enabling users to access transaction pages within one click.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store user data, transactions, and historical statistics.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process transactions within 0.25 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall maintain 99.99% uptime annually.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure structured UI navigation and accessibility.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall schedule maintenance updates between 3 AM - 6 AM CST on Wednesdays.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall restrict league management access to commissioners only.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Authentication, league management, and transactions shall be validated.
[SEC] 5. References: Fantasy football best practices, API integration, and security policies.
